name: Heck Hole
description:
A beautiful little section of waterfalls on the East face of Mt Nebo. If you're looking for some refreshing fun from the summer heat, this is primo. Depending on the exit, you can b-line it back to the starting location, or plan for an easy hike out with a shuttle.

Approach

From the Monument Trailhead, hike 3.0 miles on the Nebo Bench Trail until you come to the drainage in Hell Hole Basin. Upon reaching the drainage, if there is snow (June) the easiest approach into the gully is down the ridge (in the trees) just past the ravine. In dry conditions you will be able to enter the drainage from the trail without a problem. After some zig-zagging down and across the drainage, there is some scree bypass on the right that will lead you down to your first rappel.

Descent

Once you're at the first rappel, the technical sequence is as follows:


r1: 100', webbing DCL from a tree/roots

r2: 60', fiddle from tree LDC

r3: 50', webbing from log in waterflow (rap is 50', 100' needed)

r4: 100', fiddle from dead logs/tree DCL

r5: 40', webbing DCL from roots

Exit

Hike down the rest of the drainage until it meets up with the main canyon. LEFT will take you directly back to your car (unexplored) with about 1600' gain, but 1/2 the distance of the shuttle hike out.

Turning right will take you down to a few trail junctions, the exit used for Middle Basin, and the Right Fork Salt Creek Trail. Shuttle car will be left at the Salt Creek TH (By Bear Canyon Group Campsites).
